supporting_quotes: French Gates graduated as valedictorian from Ursuline Academy of Dallas in 1982.

roles: BA in Computer Science and Economics
supporting_quotes: She earned a bachelor's degree in computer science and economics from Duke University in 1986
and an MBA from Duke's Fuqua School of Business in 1987.
At Duke, French Gates was a member of the Kappa Alpha Theta sorority, Beta Rho Chapter.
Shortly after joining Microsoft in 1987 as a multimedia product developer
After graduation, she became a marketing manager with Microsoft, being responsible for the development of multimedia products.
In the early 1990s, French Gates was appointed as General Manager of Information Products, a position which she held until 1996.
She left Microsoft that year, reportedly, to focus on starting a family.
French Gates served as a member of Duke University's board of trustees from 1996 to 2003.
From 2000 to 2024, she and Gates co-chaired the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, the world's largest private charitable organization.
has held a seat on the board of directors of Graham Holdings (formerly The Washington Post Company) since 2004.
She was also on the board of directors at Drugstore.com but left in August 2006 to focus on philanthropic projects.
In 2015, French Gates founded Pivotal Ventures as a separate, independent organization to identify and implement innovative solutions to problems affecting U.S. women and families.
On May 13, 2024, French Gates resigned as co-chair of the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, to be effective June 7.
In 1998, Melinda and Bill Gates were each honored with an American Library Association Honorary Membership.

roles: Award for Greatest Public Service Benefiting the Disadvantaged recipient
supporting_quotes: In 2002, Melinda and Bill Gates received the Award for Greatest Public Service Benefiting the Disadvantaged, an award given out, annually, by Jefferson Awards.

roles: Person of the Year (with Bill Gates and Bono)
supporting_quotes: In December 2005, Melinda and Bill were named, by Time, as Persons of the Year, alongside Bono.

roles: Prince of Asturias Award for International Cooperation recipient
supporting_quotes: Melinda and Bill Gates received the Spanish Prince of Asturias Award for International Cooperation on May 4, 2006, in recognition of their world impact through charitable giving.

roles: honoree - Melinda French Gates Ambulatory Care building dedication
supporting_quotes: In May 2006, in honor of her work to improve the lives of children locally and around the world, Seattle Children's Hospital dedicated the Melinda French Gates Ambulatory Care building
She chaired a campaign for the hospital to fundraise $300 million to expand facilities

roles: Insignia of the Order of the Aztec Eagle recipient
supporting_quotes: In November 2006, French Gates was awarded the Insignia of the Order of the Aztec Eagle, together, with Bill, who was awarded the Placard of the same order, both for their philanthropic work around the world in the areas of health and education, particularly in Mexico
In 2007, French Gates received an honorary doctorate in medicine from the Karolinska Institute in Stockholm, Sweden.
In 2009, she and her then-husband received honorary degrees from the University of Cambridge.

roles: honorary Doctor of Humane Letters recipient
supporting_quotes: she was awarded an honorary Doctor of Humane Letters by Duke University, in 2013, in honor of her philanthropic commitment.
She was awarded the UCSF medal in 2013.

roles: honorary Dame Commander of the Order of the British Empire (DBE)
supporting_quotes: French Gates was appointed an honorary Dame Commander of the Order of the British Empire (DBE) in 2013, for services to philanthropy and international development.
In recognition of the foundation's philanthropic activities in India, Bill and Melinda, jointly, received India's third-highest civilian honor, Padma Bhushan, in 2015.
In 2016, President Barack Obama awarded French Gates and her husband with the Presidential Medal of Freedom, for their philanthropic efforts.

roles: Commander of the Legion of Honour recipient
supporting_quotes: In 2017, President Fran√ßois Hollande awarded France's highest national honor to French Gates and her husband, for their charitable efforts, i.e. as Commander of the Legion of Honour.
That year, she was awarded the Otto Hahn Peace Medal 2016 of the United Nations Association of Germany (DGVN), Berlin-Brandenburg, 'for outstanding services to peace and international understanding'

organizations: Grace Hopper Celebration of Women in Computing
supporting_quotes: French Gates also spoke about this topic at the 2017 Grace Hopper Celebration of Women in Computing, an annual series of conferences.
In 2019, French Gates debuted as an author with the book The Moment of Lift: How Empowering Women Changes the World.
French Gates was recognized as one of the BBC's 100 women of 2021.
In June 2024, she delivered the Commencement address at Stanford University.
In April 2025, she published a memoir, The Next Day: Transition, Change and Moving Forward.
